name: Osso Buco
description: A Milanese specialty of braised veal shanks, cooked slowly with vegetables, white wine, and broth, garnished with gremolata.
steps: Season veal shanks with salt and pepper and dredge in flour.
Brown the veal shanks in a heavy pot with some olive oil.
Remove shanks and saut√© onions, carrots, and celery until softened.
Deglaze the pot with white wine, then return the shanks to the pot.
Add broth until the shanks are nearly covered, bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.
Cover and cook slowly until the meat is tender, about 2 hours.
tips: Ensure the shanks are not crowded in the pot for even browning.
Can be made ahead and tastes even better the next day.
Serve with risotto or polenta to soak up the sauce.
